column1: Q17 - Have you experienced any unwelcome comment(s) or conduct at The Chronicle that you felt was offensive, embarrassing, or hurtful (e.g., inappropriate jokes, slurs, rumors, hurtful gossip, isolating behaviors)?

column2: Have you experienced any unwelcome comment(s) or conduct at The Chronicle that you felt was offensive, embarrassing, or hurtful (e.g., inappropriate jokes, slurs, rumors, hurtful gossip, isolating behaviors)?

column1: Q37 - If you feel comfortable sharing, please feel free to describe what the comment / conduct was and how it was (or was not) dealt with. Your responses will be kept confidential.
If you feel comfortable sharing, please feel free to describe what the comment / conduct was and how it was (or was not) dealt with. Your responses will be kept confidential.

Generally there is a lack of communication and yet when you don’t do something in the exact way that certain editors want there seems to be a passive aggressive response from them. I like what Indo at the Chronicle but if I didn’t the actual practice of doing what I do I wouldn’t be a member because the environment is not fun and I often feel under appreciated. It feels like kids (barely legal adults) running other kids and the power dynamic is atrocious. It is very clear that people do not respect other people’s time.
Not this year
